common_issues.title: Copilot Answer Scrolling Issue
common_issues.description: Users are experiencing issues with scrolling while Copilot is generating answers. The cursor doesn't automatically move down, requiring manual scrolling. Proposed solutions include automatic scrolling, jump to top/bottom functionality, and a two-pane view. Improvements are being implemented iteratively.

related_issues.text:
Pieces Desktop does not scroll when answering
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

2.12.2

### Early Access Program

- [X] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

When answering, the curser stays with the question, should move to the answer. Requires clicking the arrow-down symbol to the end and then fine-navigating to the begin of the answer.
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation: Scroll Behavior in Copilot 

**Key points raised:**

* Users expect to be able to scroll up while the answer is being generated.
* Users expect the view to scroll down automatically unless the user scrolled up during the generation.
* Users would like to be able to jump to the top/bottom of the last answer(s) to easily review previous responses.
* Users would like to be able to distinguish between similar answers when refining prompts.

**Problems identified:**

* Users are unable to scroll up while the answer is being generated, preventing them from consuming the first part of the content.
* Users are unable to jump to the top/bottom of the last answer(s) easily.
* Users have difficulty distinguishing between similar answers when refining prompts.

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

* The team is working on improvements to the scroll behavior in the Copilot.
* A two-pane approach similar to codeconvert.ai and phind.com is being considered.
* Improvements have been pushed out in November 2024.

**Current status/outcome:**

* Users are asked to try the latest version and report any issues.
* Some users are still experiencing problems with the scroll behavior.
* The team is continuing to work on improvements.

**Additional notes:**

* The platform and input device used by the user may affect the scroll behavior.
* The specific version of Copilot being used is important to note.

recommendations: **Improve Copilot Scrolling:** Prioritize resolving the scrolling issue during Copilot answer generation based on user feedback. Explore solutions like automatic scrolling, jump to top/bottom buttons, or a two-pane view.
**Proactive Communication:**  Keep users informed about the ongoing work to address the Copilot scrolling issue. This could involve updating the FAQ section, release notes, or in-app notifications.
**Gather More Data:** Encourage users experiencing the scrolling issue to provide details about their platform, input device, and Copilot version to help identify patterns and potential solutions.

**Prioritize "P1" and "Invalid" Tickets:**  Given the categories breakdown, focus on addressing tickets tagged as "P1" (high priority) and "invalid" to ensure critical issues and potential bugs are resolved quickly.
